text: ___________ tool is used for sniffing a network.
note: Cain and Abel is a multiple-use utility that can be used to sniff a network, crack hashes, etc.

text: How is a salted password validated?

answers.text: Retrieve the salt and hash from the database; Append the salt and the hash again with the same algorithm; Check for the resulting password hash, match or not
Check for the resulting password hash, match or not; Retrieve the salt and hash from the database; Append the salt and the hash again with the same algorithm
Append the salt and the hash again with the same algorithm; Check for the resulting password hash, match or not; Retrieve the salt and hash from the database

note: Validating a salted password is a little bit trickier because there are different hash values for different users. First step is to retrieve the salt and the hash from the database, then append that salt value to the password provided by the user and run the hash algorithm again to verify whether or not they match.

text: Which utility is used for hash insertion attack?
note: The NTPASSWD utility is used to change local administrator passwords

text: On which system do Alternate Data Streams work?
note: Only NTFS has Alternate Data Streams, which cannot be implemented on FAT.

text: What is steganography?
note: Steganography is a data hiding technique which can hide text inside an image, mp3, etc.

text: Steganography can be used as a substitute for ______.
note: Steganography can be used as a way to make a substitute for a one-way hash value or it could be used to take notes to online images to maintain confidentiality of valuable information.

text: Using alternate data streams negatively impacts the file.
For what purposes is the hash technique used?
note: If an attacker has the password hash but was unable to decrypt the hash, he or she can still login using the "pass the hash" method. In this method, password hash is passed instead of an plaintext password.

text: How can password guessing be prevented?

answers.text: Using alphanumeric passwords with both uppercase and lowercase letters
Using Syskey and storing key on an external drive

note: Using long passwords with a combination of numbers and uppercase/lowercase characters will make generated hashes much stronger against GPU cracking. The more the number of characters, the more possible password combinations.

text: Which of the following are rootkit functionalities?

answers.text: To elevate the privileges of processes
To hide files or registry entries

note: The rootkit is one of the most dangerous hacking tools available to the dark side. A tool like this does not require that much skill. But to function, it must have access to the system itself in order to place the rootkitted processes, files, or whatever on that computer.

text: Which is the strongest password among these?
note: P@5S\/\/OrD is a combination of numbers, letters, symbols, and special characters, which makes it really difficult to crack.

text: Which is a type of social engineering attack?

answers.text: Fake calling as a technician and asking the victim for system details

note: Fake calling as a technician and asking for system details. People fell victim to these kind of attacks easily when an attacker impersonates someone else and gains the trust of the victim.

text: What is the correct order of the challenge-response process of Windows authentication?
note: The system first makes a login request to the server and the server sends a challenge string, which is matched with a response from the machine. If it matches, login is permitted.

text: What is a good password policy to implement in an organization?

answers.text: Do not use a dictionary word

note: Having a good password policy in a company is a great way to ensure its data security and integrity. Every user must change his password every 2 weeks and must not use a dictionary word.

text: In which file are Windows passwords stored?
note: Windows stores its username and passwords in SAM, i.e. System Account Manager. This file is located in the system32 folder in the system drive.

text: What type of encryption does NTLM use?
note: NTLM uses MD5 algorithm, which is a one-way hashing method in which a text is passed through an algorithm and a 32 character long hash is generated which cannot be reversed by any means to get the original content.

text: How can an MD5 hash be cracked?
note: Rainbow tables are a set of precomputed hashes that have their corresponding plaintext known to the attacker. Here the password hash from the victim machine is matched with a large set of these precomputed hashes, and if any match occurs then the attacker will have the already known plaintext password.

text: Which of the following operating systems employs Kerberos authentication?
note: Windows 2000 uses Kerberos authentication.

text: ___________ tool is used for sniffing a network.
note: Cain and Abel is a multiple-use utility that can be used to sniff a network, crack hashes, etc.

text: How can rootkits be prevented?
note: Anti-rootkits can provide a maximum level of security against rootkits as they are specifically designed for this purpose.

text: What is the maximum length of a LanMan Hash?
note: A LanMan hash has a maximum of 14 characters

text: What is needed to successfully crack an FTP password?
note: A good word list will be helpful in cracking passwords. One can use a dictionary word list to make it faster.
